refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This tool is part of the samba 7 suite.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS

refsect3.title: computer add computername [options]
refsect3.para: Add a new computer to the Active Directory Domain.
The new computer name specified on the command is the sAMAccountName, with or without the trailing dollar sign.

listitem.para: DN of alternative location (with or without domainDN counterpart) to default CN=Computers in which new computer object will be created. E.g. 'OU=OUname'.
The new computer's description.
IPv4 address for the computer's A record, or IPv6 address for AAAA record, can be provided multiple times.
Computer's Service Principal Name, can be provided multiple times.
Prepare enabled machine account for oldjoin mechanism.

refsect3.title: computer create computername [options]
refsect3.para: Add a new computer. This is a synonym for the samba-tool computer add command and is available for compatibility reasons only. Please use samba-tool computer add instead.

refsect3.title: computer delete computername [options]
refsect3.para: Delete an existing computer account.
The computer name specified on the command is the sAMAccountName, with or without the trailing dollar sign.

refsect3.title: computer edit computername
refsect3.para: Edit a computer AD object.
The computer name specified on the command is the sAMAccountName, with or without the trailing dollar sign.

listitem.para: Specifies the editor to use instead of the system default, or 'vi' if no system default is set.

refsect3.title: computer list
refsect3.para: List all computers.

refsect3.title: computer move computername new_parent_dn [options]
refsect3.para: This command moves a computer account into the specified organizational unit or container.
The computername specified on the command is the sAMAccountName, with or without the trailing dollar sign.
The name of the organizational unit or container can be specified as a full DN or without the domainDN component.

refsect3.title: computer show computername [options]
refsect3.para: Display a computer AD object.
The computer name specified on the command is the sAMAccountName, with or without the trailing dollar sign.

listitem.para: Comma separated list of attributes, which will be printed.

refsect3.title: contact add [contactname] [options]
refsect3.para: Add a new contact to the Active Directory Domain.

The name of the new contact can be specified by the first argument 'contactname' or the --given-name, --initial and --surname arguments. If no 'contactname' is given, contact's name will be made up of the given arguments by combining the given-name, initials and surname. Each argument is optional. A dot ('.') will be appended to the initials automatically.

listitem.para: DN of alternative location (with or without domainDN counterpart) in which the new contact will be created. E.g. 'OU=OUname'. Default is the domain base.
The new contact's description.
Contact's surname.
Contact's given name.
Contact's initials.
Contact's display name.
Contact's job title.
Contact's department.
Contact's company.
Contact's email address.
Contact's home page.
Contact's phone number.
Contact's mobile phone number.
Contact's office location.

refsect3.title: contact create [contactname] [options]
refsect3.para: Add a new contact. This is a synonym for the samba-tool contact add command and is available for compatibility reasons only. Please use samba-tool contact add instead.

refsect3.title: contact delete contactname [options]
refsect3.para: Delete an existing contact.

The contactname specified on the command is the common name or the distinguished name of the contact object. The distinguished name of the contact can be specified with or without the domainDN component.

refsect3.title: contact edit contactname
refsect3.para: Modify a contact AD object.

The contactname specified on the command is the common name or the distinguished name of the contact object. The distinguished name of the contact can be specified with or without the domainDN component.

listitem.para: Specifies the editor to use instead of the system default, or 'vi' if no system default is set.

refsect3.title: contact list [options]
refsect3.para: List all contacts.

listitem.para: Display contact's full DN instead of the name.

refsect3.title: contact move contactname new_parent_dn [options]
refsect3.para: This command moves a contact into the specified organizational unit or container.

The contactname specified on the command is the common name or the distinguished name of the contact object. The distinguished name of the contact can be specified with or without the domainDN component.

refsect3.title: contact show contactname [options]
refsect3.para: Display a contact AD object.

The contactname specified on the command is the common name or the distinguished name of the contact object. The distinguished name of the contact can be specified with or without the domainDN component.

listitem.para: Comma separated list of attributes, which will be printed.

refsect3.title: contact rename contactname [options]
refsect3.para: Rename a contact and related attributes.

This command allows to set the contact's name related attributes. The contact's CN will be renamed automatically. The contact's new CN will be made up by combining the given-name, initials and surname. A dot ('.') will be appended to the initials automatically, if required. Use the --force-new-cn option to specify the new CN manually and --reset-cn to reset this change.
Use an empty attribute value to remove the specified attribute.
The contact name specified on the command is the CN.

listitem.para: New surname.
New given name.
New initials.
Specify a new CN (RDN) instead of using a combination of the given name, initials and surname.
Set the CN to the default combination of given name, initials and surname.
New display name.
New email address.

refsect2.title: dbcheck
refsect2.para: Check the local AD database for errors.

refsect3.title: delegation add-principal accountname principal [options]
refsect3.para: Add a principal to msDS-AllowedToActOnBehalfOfOtherIdentity that may delegate to an account.

refsect3.title: delegation del-principal accountname principal [options]
refsect3.para: Delete a principal from msDS-AllowedToActOnBehalfOfOtherIdentity so that it may no longer delegate to an account.

refsect3.title: delegation add-service accountname principal [options]
refsect3.para: Add a service principal as msDS-AllowedToDelegateTo.

refsect3.title: delegation del-service accountname principal [options]
refsect3.para: Delete a service principal as msDS-AllowedToDelegateTo.

refsect3.title: delegation for-any-protocol accountname [(on|off)] [options]
refsect3.para: Set/unset UF_TRUSTED_TO_AUTHENTICATE_FOR_DELEGATION (S4U2Proxy) for an account.

refsect3.title: delegation for-any-service accountname [(on|off)] [options]
refsect3.para: Set/unset UF_TRUSTED_FOR_DELEGATION for an account.

refsect3.title: delegation show accountname [options]
refsect3.para: Show the delegation setting of an account.

refsect3.title: dns add server zone name A|AAAA|PTR|CNAME|NS|MX|SRV|TXT data
refsect3.para: Add a DNS record.

refsect3.title: dns cleanup server name
refsect3.para: Clean up DNS records for a host, so that DNS queries no longer return results. Usually this works by marking the records as deleted in the database.
Example: samba-tool dns cleanup dc1 computer.samdom.test.site

refsect3.title: dns delete server zone name A|AAAA|PTR|CNAME|NS|MX|SRV|TXT data
refsect3.para: Delete a DNS record.

refsect3.title: dns query server zone name A|AAAA|PTR|CNAME|NS|MX|SRV|TXT|ALL [options] data
refsect3.para: Query a name.

refsect3.title: dns roothints server [name] [options]
refsect3.para: Query root hints.

refsect3.title: dns serverinfo server [options]
refsect3.para: Query server information.

refsect3.title: dns update server zone name A|AAAA|PTR|CNAME|NS|MX|SRV|TXT olddata newdata
refsect3.para: Update a DNS record.

refsect3.title: dns zonecreate server zone [options]
refsect3.para: Create a zone.

refsect3.title: dns zonedelete server zone [options]
refsect3.para: Delete a zone.

refsect3.title: dns zoneinfo server zone [options]
refsect3.para: Query zone information.

refsect3.title: dns zonelist server [options]
refsect3.para: List zones.

refsect3.title: dns zoneoptions server zone [options]
refsect3.para: Manipulate aging options. This is useful in zones using dynamic DNS.
There are options to change records from static to dynamic based on regular expressions or age, which is useful in some cases where the values got mixed up in old versions of Samba.

listitem.para: Do not actually change anything, but show what would happen.
Windows client protocol version. The default is longhorn, which is probably what you want.
Mark records older than the specified date as static.
Mark records that match the given perl-compatible regular expression as static.
Mark records that match the given perl-compatible regular expression as dynamic.
--aging=1 to enable aging for this zone.
--aging=0 to disable aging for this zone.
avoid further refreshes for this long after a dynamic update. Set to zero to use the default.
Dynamic refresh interval in hours (0: use default)

refsect3.title: domain backup
refsect3.para: Create or restore a backup of the domain.

refsect3.title: domain backup offline
refsect3.para: Backup (with proper locking) local domain directories into a tar file.

refsect3.title: domain backup online
refsect3.para: Copy a running DC's current DB into a backup tar file.

refsect3.title: domain backup rename
refsect3.para: Copy a running DC's DB to backup file, renaming the domain in the process.

refsect3.title: domain backup restore
refsect3.para: Restore the domain's DB from a backup-file.

refsect3.title: domain auth policy list
refsect3.para: List authentication policies on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
View authentication policies as JSON instead of a list.

refsect3.title: domain auth policy view
refsect3.para: View an authentication policy on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of the authentication policy to view (required).

refsect3.title: domain auth policy create
refsect3.para: Create authentication policies on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of the authentication policy (required).
Optional description for the authentication policy.
Protect authentication policy from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --unprotect.
Unprotect authentication policy from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --protect.
Only audit authentication policy.
Cannot be used together with --enforce.
Enforce authentication policy.
Cannot be used together with --audit.
Strong NTLM Policy (Disabled, Optional, Required).
Ticket-Granting-Ticket lifetime for user accounts.
Allow NTLM and Interactive NETLOGON SamLogon authentication despite the fact that allowed-to-authenticate-from is in use, which would otherwise restrict the user to selected devices.

Conditions a device must meet for users covered by this policy to be allowed to authenticate. While this is a restriction on the device, any conditional ACE rules are expressed as if the device was a user.
Must be a valid SDDL string without reference to Device keywords.
Example: O:SYG:SYD:(XA;OICI;CR;;;WD;(Member_of {SID(AU)}))
This policy, applying to a user account that is offering a service, eg a web server with a user account, restricts which accounts may access it.
Must be a valid SDDL string. The SDDL can reference both bare (user) and Device conditions.
SDDL Example: O:SYG:SYD:(XA;OICI;CR;;;WD;(Member_of {SID(AO)}))
Ticket-Granting-Ticket lifetime for service accounts.
Allow NTLM network authentication when service is restricted to selected devices.

Conditions a device must meet for service accounts covered by this policy to be allowed to authenticate. While this is a restriction on the device, any conditional ACE rules are expressed as if the device was a user.
Must be a valid SDDL string without reference to Device keywords.
SDDL Example: O:SYG:SYD:(XA;OICI;CR;;;WD;(Member_of {SID(AU)}))
This policy, applying to a service account (eg a Managed Service Account, Group Managed Service Account), restricts which accounts may access it.
Must be a valid SDDL string. The SDDL can reference both bare (user) and Device conditions.
SDDL Example: O:SYG:SYD:(XA;OICI;CR;;;WD;(Member_of {SID(AO)}))
Ticket-Granting-Ticket lifetime for computer accounts.
This policy, applying to a computer account (eg a server or workstation), restricts which accounts may access it.
Must be a valid SDDL string. The SDDL can reference both bare (user) and Device conditions.
SDDL Example: O:SYG:SYD:(XA;OICI;CR;;;WD;(Member_of {SID(AO)}))

refsect3.title: domain auth policy modify
refsect3.para: Modify authentication policies on the domain. The same options apply as for domain auth policy create.

refsect3.title: domain auth policy delete
refsect3.para: Delete authentication policies on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication policy to delete (required).
Force authentication policy delete even if it is protected.

refsect3.title: domain auth policy user-allowed-to-authenticate-from set
refsect3.para: Set the user-allowed-to-authenticate-from property by scenario.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication policy.
User is allowed to authenticate, if the device they authenticate from is assigned and granted membership of a given GROUP.
User is allowed to authenticate, if the device they authenticate from is assigned and granted membership of a given SILO.

refsect3.title: domain auth policy user-allowed-to-authenticate-to set
refsect3.para: Set the user-allowed-to-authenticate-to property by scenario.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication policy.
The user account, offering a network service, covered by this policy, will only be allowed access from other accounts that are members of the given GROUP.

The user account, offering a network service, covered by this policy, will only be allowed access from other accounts that are assigned to, granted membership of (and meet any authentication conditions of) the given SILO.

refsect3.title: domain auth policy service-allowed-to-authenticate-from set
refsect3.para: Set the service-allowed-to-authenticate-from property by scenario.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication policy.
The service account (eg a Managed Service Account, Group Managed Service Account) is allowed to authenticate, if the device it authenticates from is a member of the given GROUP.
The service account (eg a Managed Service Account, Group Managed Service Account) is allowed to authenticate, if the device it authenticates from is assigned and granted membership of a given SILO.

refsect3.title: domain auth policy service-allowed-to-authenticate-to set
refsect3.para: Set the service-allowed-to-authenticate-to property by scenario.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication policy.
The service account (eg a Managed Service Account, Group Managed Service Account), will only be allowed access by other accounts that are members of the given GROUP.

The service account (eg a Managed Service Account, Group Managed Service Account), will only be allowed access by other accounts that are assigned to, granted membership of (and meet any authentication conditions of) the given SILO.

refsect3.title: domain auth policy computer-allowed-to-authenticate-to set
refsect3.para: Set the computer-allowed-to-authenticate-to property by scenario.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication policy.
The computer account (eg a server or workstation), will only be allowed access by other accounts that are members of the given GROUP.

The computer account (eg a server or workstation), will only be allowed access by other accounts that are assigned to, granted membership of (and meet any authentication conditions of) the given SILO.

refsect3.title: domain auth silo list
refsect3.para: List authentication silos on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
View authentication silos as JSON instead of a list.

refsect3.title: domain auth silo view
refsect3.para: View an authentication silo on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of the authentication silo to view (required).

refsect3.title: domain auth silo create
refsect3.para: Create authentication silos on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of the authentication silo (required).
Optional description for the authentication silo.
User account authentication policy.
Managed service account authentication policy.
Computer authentication policy.
Protect authentication silo from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --unprotect.
Unprotect authentication silo from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --protect.
Only audit silo policies.
Cannot be used together with --enforce.
Enforce silo policies.
Cannot be used together with --audit.

refsect3.title: domain auth silo modify
refsect3.para: Modify authentication silos on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of the authentication silo (required).
Optional description for the authentication silo.
User account authentication policy.
Managed service account authentication policy.
Computer authentication policy.
Protect authentication silo from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --unprotect.
Unprotect authentication silo from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --protect.
Only audit silo policies.
Cannot be used together with --enforce.
Enforce silo policies.
Cannot be used together with --audit.

refsect3.title: domain auth silo delete
refsect3.para: Delete authentication silos on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication silo to delete (required).
Force authentication silo delete even if it is protected.

refsect3.title: domain auth silo member grant
refsect3.para: Grant a member access to an authentication silo.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication silo (required).
Member to grant access to the silo (DN or account name).

refsect3.title: domain auth silo member list
refsect3.para: List members in an authentication silo.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication silo (required).
View members as JSON instead of a list.

refsect3.title: domain auth silo member revoke
refsect3.para: Revoke a member from an authentication silo.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Name of authentication silo (required).
Member to revoke from the silo (DN or account name).

refsect3.title: domain claim claim-type list
refsect3.para: List claim types on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
View claim types as JSON instead of a list.

refsect3.title: domain claim claim-type view
refsect3.para: View a single claim type on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Display name of claim type to view (required).

refsect3.title: domain claim claim-type create
refsect3.para: Create claim types on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Attribute of claim type to create (required).
Object classes to set claim type to.
Example: --class=user --class=computer
Optional display name or use attribute name.
Optional description or use from attribute.
Enable claim type.
Cannot be used together with --disable.
Disable claim type.
Cannot be used together with --enable.
Protect claim type from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --unprotect.
Unprotect claim type from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --protect.

refsect3.title: domain claim claim-type modify
refsect3.para: Modify claim types on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Display name of claim type to modify (required).
Object classes to set claim type to.
Example: --class=user --class=computer
Set the claim type description.
Enable claim type.
Cannot be used together with --disable.
Disable claim type.
Cannot be used together with --enable.
Protect claim type from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --unprotect.
Unprotect claim type from accidental deletion.
Cannot be used together with --protect.

refsect3.title: domain claim claim-type delete
refsect3.para: Delete claim types on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Display name of claim type to delete (required).
Force claim type delete even if it is protected.

refsect3.title: domain claim value-type list
refsect3.para: List claim value types on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
View claim value types as JSON instead of a list.

refsect3.title: domain claim value-type view
refsect3.para: View a single claim value type on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Display name of claim value type to view (required).

refsect3.title: service-account list
refsect3.para: List service accounts on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
View service accounts as JSON instead of a list.

refsect3.title: service-account view
refsect3.para: View a single service account on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Account name of service account to view (required).

refsect3.title: service-account create
refsect3.para: Create a new service account on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Account name of service account (required).
DNS hostname of this service account (required).
Optional Group MSA Membership SDDL.
Managed password refresh interval in days.

refsect3.title: service-account modify
refsect3.para: Modify an existing service account on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Account name of service account (required).
Update DNS hostname of this service account.
Update Group MSA Membership SDDL.

refsect3.title: service-account delete
refsect3.para: Delete a service accounts on the domain.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Account name of service account to delete.

refsect2.title: service-account group-msa-membership
refsect2.para: Service account Group MSA Membership management.

refsect3.title: service-account group-msa-membership show
refsect3.para: Display Group MSA Membership for a service account.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Account name of service account (required).
Return as JSON instead of a list.

refsect3.title: service-account group-msa-membership add
refsect3.para: Add a principal to Group MSA Membership for a service account.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Account name of service account (required).
Name, DN or SID of principal to add.

refsect3.title: service-account group-msa-membership remove
refsect3.para: Remove a principal from Group MSA Membership for a service account.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Account name of service account (required).
Name, DN or SID of principal to remove.

refsect3.title: domain classicupgrade [options] classic_smb_conf
refsect3.para: Upgrade from Samba classic (NT4-like) database to Samba AD DC database.

refsect3.title: domain dcpromo dnsdomain [DC|RODC] [options]
refsect3.para: Promote an existing domain member or NT4 PDC to an AD DC.

refsect3.title: domain demote
refsect3.para: Demote ourselves from the role of domain controller.

refsect3.title: domain exportkeytab keytab [options]
refsect3.para: Dumps Kerberos keys of the domain into a keytab.

refsect3.title: domain functionalprep [options]
refsect3.para: Prepare a domain for functional level upgrade. If --functional-level is not used, the latest supported version is used (currently 2016).

There are two aspects to this preparation, relating to the forest and the domain. By default both are run. If either of --forest-prep or --domain-prep are used, only the corresponding preparation is made. If both arguments are used together, all preparation is done, just as when neither is used.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
The functional level to prepare for. The default is 2016.
Run forest preparation only (unless --domain-prep is also used).
Run domain preparation only (unless --forest-prep is also used).

refsect3.title: domain info ip_address [options]
refsect3.para: Print basic info about a domain and the specified DC.

refsect3.title: domain join dnsdomain [DC|RODC|MEMBER|SUBDOMAIN] [options]
refsect3.para: Join a domain as either member or backup domain controller.

refsect3.title: domain kds root-key
refsect3.para: Manage Key Distribution Service root keys.

refsect3.title: domain kds root-key create [options]
refsect3.para: Create KDS root keys

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
The key will be valid from this time.

Valid time format are the string "now", the LDIF format YYYYmmddHHMMSS.0Z, or the ISO format YYYY-mm-dd[*HH[:MM[:SS[.fff[fff]]]][+HH:MM[:SS[.ffffff]]]] where the '*' can be any character, and the optional last '[+HH:MM[:SS[.ffffff]]]' is a timezone offset (e.g. '+00:00' for UTC).
Output results in JSON format.

refsect3.title: domain kds root-key delete --name={GUID}
refsect3.para: Delete the named KDS root key. Use samba-tool domain kds root-key list to find the name of the key.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
The name of the key to delete. It will be a GUID.
Print all attributes (except secret ones, unless --show secrets is used).
Output results in JSON format.

refsect3.title: domain kds root-key list [options]
refsect3.para: List KDS root keys. The newest keys are listed first.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Print secret or potentially sensitive attributes, namely msKds-RootKeyData and msKds-SecretAgreementParam.
Print more attributes (but not secret ones, unless --show secrets is also used).
Output results in JSON format.

refsect3.title: domain kds root-key view [options]
refsect3.para: View a KDS root key. The default output is similar to that of samba-tool domain kds root-key list --verbose, but with only one key show. The key can be selected by using --latest for the most recent key, or --name to select a key by name.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
View the most recent root key.
The name of the key to view. It will be a GUID.
Print all attributes (except secret ones, unless --show secrets is used). This includes attributes that are only useful for LDB bookkeeping.
Output results in JSON format.

refsect3.title: domain leave [options]
refsect3.para: Run on a domain member, this will cause it to leave the domain.
To remove a domain server from the domain, you first need samba-tool domain demote.

listitem.para: Disable the machine account instead of deleting it.

refsect3.title: domain level show|raise options [options]
refsect3.para: Show/raise domain and forest function levels.

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings show|set options [options]
refsect3.para: Show/set password settings.

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso
refsect3.para: Manage fine-grained Password Settings Objects (PSOs).

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso apply pso-name user-or-group-name [options]
refsect3.para: Applies a PSO's password policy to a user or group.

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso create pso-name precedence [options]
refsect3.para: Creates a new Password Settings Object (PSO).

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso delete pso-name [options]
refsect3.para: Deletes a Password Settings Object (PSO).

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso list [options]
refsect3.para: Lists all Password Settings Objects (PSOs).

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso set pso-name [options]
refsect3.para: Modifies a Password Settings Object (PSO).

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso show user-name [options]
refsect3.para: Displays a Password Settings Object (PSO).

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso show-user pso-name [options]
refsect3.para: Displays the Password Settings that apply to a user.

refsect3.title: domain passwordsettings pso unapply pso-name user-or-group-name [options]
refsect3.para: Updates a PSO to no longer apply to a user or group.

refsect3.title: domain provision
refsect3.para: Promote an existing domain member or NT4 PDC to an AD DC.

refsect3.title: domain schemaupgrade [options]
refsect3.para: Upgrade the schema.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.
Upgrade to this Windows schema level. The default is 2019.
Apply the schema changes in this LDIF file, rather than updating to a standard schema level.
Specify an alternate location to find schema LDIF files.
LDB URL for database or target server
The current time to evaluate the tombstone lifetime from, expressed as YYYY-MM-DD
Number of days a tombstone should be preserved for

refsect3.title: domain trust
refsect3.para: Domain and forest trust management.

refsect3.title: domain trust create DOMAIN options [options]
refsect3.para: Create a domain or forest trust.

refsect3.title: domain trust modify DOMAIN options [options]
refsect3.para: Modify a domain or forest trust.

refsect3.title: domain trust delete DOMAIN options [options]
refsect3.para: Delete a domain trust.

refsect3.title: domain trust list options [options]
refsect3.para: List domain trusts.

refsect3.title: domain trust namespaces [DOMAIN] options [options]
refsect3.para: Manage forest trust namespaces.

refsect3.title: domain trust show DOMAIN options [options]
refsect3.para: Show trusted domain details.

refsect3.title: domain trust validate DOMAIN options [options]
refsect3.para: Validate a domain trust.

refsect3.title: drs bind
refsect3.para: Show DRS capabilities of a server.

refsect3.title: drs kcc
refsect3.para: Trigger knowledge consistency center run.

refsect3.title: drs options
refsect3.para: Query or change options for NTDS Settings object of a domain controller.

refsect3.title: drs replicate destination_DC source_DC NC [options]
refsect3.para: Replicate a naming context between two DCs.

refsect3.title: drs showrepl
refsect3.para: Show replication status. The --json option results in JSON output, and with the --summary option produces very little output when the replication status seems healthy.

refsect3.title: dsacl delete
refsect3.para: Delete an access list entry on a directory object.

refsect3.title: dsacl get
refsect3.para: Print access list on a directory object.

refsect3.title: dsacl set
refsect3.para: Modify access list on a directory object.

refsect3.title: forest directory_service
refsect3.para: Manage directory_service behaviour for the forest.

refsect3.title: forest directory_service dsheuristics VALUE
refsect3.para: Modify dsheuristics directory_service configuration for the forest.

refsect3.title: forest directory_service show
refsect3.para: Show current directory_service configuration for the forest.

refsect3.title: fsmo seize [options]
refsect3.para: Seize the role.

refsect3.title: fsmo show
refsect3.para: Show the roles.

refsect3.title: fsmo transfer [options]
refsect3.para: Transfer the role.

refsect3.title: gpo create displayname [options]
refsect3.para: Create an empty GPO.

refsect3.title: gpo del gpo [options]
refsect3.para: Delete GPO.

refsect3.title: gpo dellink container_dn gpo [options]
refsect3.para: Delete GPO link from a container.

refsect3.title: gpo fetch gpo [options]
refsect3.para: Download a GPO.

refsect3.title: gpo getinheritance container_dn [options]
refsect3.para: Get inheritance flag for a container.

refsect3.title: gpo getlink container_dn [options]
refsect3.para: List GPO Links for a container.

refsect3.title: gpo list username [options]
refsect3.para: List GPOs for an account.

refsect3.title: gpo listall
refsect3.para: List all GPOs.

refsect3.title: gpo listcontainers gpo [options]
refsect3.para: List all linked containers for a GPO.

refsect3.title: gpo setinheritance container_dn block|inherit [options]
refsect3.para: Set inheritance flag on a container.

refsect3.title: gpo setlink container_dn gpo [options]
refsect3.para: Add or Update a GPO link to a container.

refsect3.title: gpo show gpo [options]
refsect3.para: Show information for a GPO.

refsect3.title: gpo manage symlink list
refsect3.para: List VGP Symbolic Link Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage symlink add
refsect3.para: Adds a VGP Symbolic Link Group Policy to the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage symlink remove
refsect3.para: Removes a VGP Symbolic Link Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage files list
refsect3.para: List VGP Files Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage files add
refsect3.para: Add VGP Files Group Policy to the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage files remove
refsect3.para: Remove VGP Files Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage openssh list
refsect3.para: List VGP OpenSSH Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage openssh set
refsect3.para: Sets a VGP OpenSSH Group Policy to the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage sudoers add
refsect3.para: Adds a Samba Sudoers Group Policy to the sysvol.

refsect3.title: gpo manage sudoers list
refsect3.para: List Samba Sudoers Group Policy from the sysvol.

refsect3.title: gpo manage sudoers remove
refsect3.para: Removes a Samba Sudoers Group Policy from the sysvol.

refsect3.title: gpo manage scripts startup list
refsect3.para: List VGP Startup Script Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage scripts startup add
refsect3.para: Adds VGP Startup Script Group Policy to the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage scripts startup remove
refsect3.para: Removes VGP Startup Script Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage motd list
refsect3.para: List VGP MOTD Group Policy from the sysvol.

refsect3.title: gpo manage motd set
refsect3.para: Sets a VGP MOTD Group Policy to the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage issue list
refsect3.para: List VGP Issue Group Policy from the sysvol.

refsect3.title: gpo manage issue set
refsect3.para: Sets a VGP Issue Group Policy to the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage access add
refsect3.para: Adds a VGP Host Access Group Policy to the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage access list
refsect3.para: List VGP Host Access Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: gpo manage access remove
refsect3.para: Remove a VGP Host Access Group Policy from the sysvol

refsect3.title: group add groupname [options]
refsect3.para: Create a new AD group.

refsect3.title: group create groupname [options]
refsect3.para: Add a new AD group. This is a synonym for the samba-tool group add command and is available for compatibility reasons only. Please use samba-tool group add instead.

refsect3.title: group addmembers groupname members [options]
refsect3.para: Add members to an AD group.

refsect3.title: group delete groupname [options]
refsect3.para: Delete an AD group.

refsect3.title: group edit groupname
refsect3.para: Edit a group AD object.

listitem.para: Specifies the editor to use instead of the system default, or 'vi' if no system default is set.

refsect3.title: group list
refsect3.para: List all groups.

refsect3.title: group listmembers groupname [options]
refsect3.para: List all members of the specified AD group.
By default the sAMAccountNames are listed. If no sAMAccountName is available, the CN will be used instead.

listitem.para: List the distinguished names instead of the sAMAccountNames.
Do not list expired group members.
Do not list disabled group members.

refsect3.title: group move groupname new_parent_dn [options]
refsect3.para: This command moves a group into the specified organizational unit or container.
The groupname specified on the command is the sAMAccountName.
The name of the organizational unit or container can be specified as a full DN or without the domainDN component.

refsect3.title: group removemembers groupname members [options]
refsect3.para: Remove members from the specified AD group.

refsect3.title: group show groupname [options]
refsect3.para: Show group object and it's attributes.

refsect3.title: group stats [options]
refsect3.para: Show statistics for overall groups and group memberships.

refsect3.title: group rename groupname [options]
refsect3.para: Rename a group and related attributes.

This command allows to set the group's name related attributes. The group's CN will be renamed automatically. The group's CN will be the sAMAccountName. Use the --force-new-cn option to specify the new CN manually and the --reset-cn to reset this change.
Use an empty attribute value to remove the specified attribute.
The groupname specified on the command is the sAMAccountName.

listitem.para: Specify a new CN (RDN) instead of using the sAMAccountName.
Set the CN to the sAMAccountName.
New mail address
New account name (sAMAccountName/logon name)

refsect3.title: ntacl changedomsid original-domain-SID new-domain-SID file [options]
refsect3.para: Change the domain SID for ACLs. Can be used to change all entries in acl_xattr when the machine's SID has accidentally changed or the data set has been copied to another machine either via backup/restore or rsync.

listitem.para: Set the ACLs directly to the TDB or xattr. The POSIX permissions will NOT be changed, only the NT ACL will be stored.
Specify the name of the smb.conf service to use. This option is required in combination with the --use-s3fs option.
Set the ACLs for use with the default s3fs file server via the VFS layer. This option requires a smb.conf service, specified by the --service=SERVICE option.
Specify the xattr backend type (native fs or tdb).
Name of the tdb file where attributes are stored.
Set the ACLs for directories and their contents recursively.
Follow symlinks when --recursive is specified.
Verbosely list files and ACLs which are being processed.

refsect3.title: ntacl get file [options]
refsect3.para: Get ACLs on a file.

refsect3.title: ntacl set acl file [options]
refsect3.para: Set ACLs on a file.

refsect3.title: ntacl sysvolcheck
refsect3.para: Check sysvol ACLs match defaults (including correct ACLs on GPOs).

refsect3.title: ntacl sysvolreset
refsect3.para: Reset sysvol ACLs to defaults (including correct ACLs on GPOs).

refsect3.title: ou add ou_dn [options]
refsect3.para: Add a new organizational unit.
The name of the organizational unit can be specified as a full DN or without the domainDN component.

listitem.para: Specify OU's description.

refsect3.title: ou create ou_dn [options]
refsect3.para: Add a new organizational unit. This is a synonym for the samba-tool ou add command and is available for compatibility reasons only. Please use samba-tool ou add instead.

refsect3.title: ou delete ou_dn [options]
refsect3.para: Delete an organizational unit.
The name of the organizational unit can be specified as a full DN or without the domainDN component.

listitem.para: Delete organizational unit and all children recursively.

refsect3.title: ou list [options]
refsect3.para: List all organizational units.

listitem.para: Display DNs including the base DN.

refsect3.title: ou listobjects ou_dn [options]
refsect3.para: List all objects in an organizational unit.
The name of the organizational unit can be specified as a full DN or without the domainDN component.

listitem.para: Display DNs including the base DN.
List objects recursively.

refsect3.title: ou move old_ou_dn new_parent_dn [options]
refsect3.para: Move an organizational unit.
The name of the organizational units can be specified as a full DN or without the domainDN component.

refsect3.title: ou rename old_ou_dn new_ou_dn [options]
refsect3.para: Rename an organizational unit.
The name of the organizational units can be specified as a full DN or without the domainDN component.

refsect2.title: processes
refsect2.para: If no processes are show, but Samba is running, it is possible that samba-tool has not found the correct smb.conf, and the use of -s/--configfile is required.

listitem.para: Show processes associated with the given name.
Show names associated with the PID.

refsect3.title: rodc preload SID|DN|accountname [options]
refsect3.para: Preload one account for an RODC.

refsect3.title: schema attribute modify attribute [options]
refsect3.para: Modify the behaviour of an attribute in schema.

refsect3.title: schema attribute show attribute [options]
refsect3.para: Display an attribute schema definition.

refsect3.title: schema attribute show_oc attribute [options]
refsect3.para: Show objectclasses that MAY or MUST contain this attribute.

refsect3.title: schema objectclass show objectclass [options]
refsect3.para: Display an objectclass schema definition.

refsect2.title: shell
refsect2.para: Opens an interactive Samba Python shell.

refsect3.title: shell [options]
refsect3.para: Opens an interactive Python shell for Samba ldb connection.

listitem.para: LDB URL for database or target server.

refsect3.title: sites list [options]
refsect3.para: List sites.

listitem.para: Output as JSON instead of a list

refsect3.title: sites view site [options]
refsect3.para: View site details.

refsect3.title: sites create site [options]
refsect3.para: Create a new site.

refsect3.title: sites remove site [options]
refsect3.para: Delete an existing site.

refsect3.title: sites subnet list site [options]
refsect3.para: List subnets for a site.

listitem.para: Output as JSON instead of a list

refsect3.title: sites subnet view subnet [options]
refsect3.para: View subnet details.

refsect3.title: sites subnet create subnet site-of-subnet [options]
refsect3.para: Create a new subnet.

refsect3.title: sites subnet remove subnet [options]
refsect3.para: Delete an existing subnet.

refsect3.title: sites subnet set-site subnet site-of-subnet [options]
refsect3.para: Assign a subnet to a site.

refsect3.title: spn add name user [options]
refsect3.para: Create a new SPN.

refsect3.title: spn delete name [user] [options]
refsect3.para: Delete an existing SPN.

refsect3.title: spn list user [options]
refsect3.para: List SPNs of a given user.

refsect2.title: testparm
refsect2.para: Check the syntax of the configuration file.

refsect2.title: time
refsect2.para: Retrieve the time on a server.

refsect3.title: user add username [password]
refsect3.para: Add a new user to the Active Directory Domain.

refsect3.title: user create username [password]
refsect3.para: Add a new user. This is a synonym for the samba-tool user add command and is available for compatibility reasons only. Please use samba-tool user add instead.

refsect3.title: user delete username [options]
refsect3.para: Delete an existing user account.

refsect3.title: user disable username
refsect3.para: Disable a user account.

listitem.para: Remove user from all groups, but keep the primary group.

refsect3.title: user edit username
refsect3.para: Edit a user account AD object.

listitem.para: Specifies the editor to use instead of the system default, or 'vi' if no system default is set.

refsect3.title: user enable username
refsect3.para: Enable a user account.

refsect3.title: user list
refsect3.para: List all users.
By default the user's sAMAccountNames are listed.

listitem.para: List user's distinguished names instead of the sAMAccountNames.
Specify base DN to use. Only users under the specified base DN will be listed.
Do not list expired user accounts.
Do not list disabled user accounts.
Only list locked user accounts.

refsect3.title: user setprimarygroup username primarygroupname
refsect3.para: Set the primary group a user account.

refsect3.title: user getgroups username
refsect3.para: Get the direct group memberships of a user account.

refsect3.title: user show username [options]
refsect3.para: Display a user AD object.

listitem.para: Comma separated list of attributes, which will be printed.

refsect3.title: user move username new_parent_dn [options]
refsect3.para: This command moves a user account into the specified organizational unit or container.
The username specified on the command is the sAMAccountName.
The name of the organizational unit or container can be specified as a full DN or without the domainDN component.

refsect3.title: user password [options]
refsect3.para: Change password for a user account (the one provided in authentication).

refsect3.title: user rename username [options]
refsect3.para: Rename a user and related attributes.

This command allows to set the user's name related attributes. The user's CN will be renamed automatically. The user's new CN will be made up by combining the given-name, initials and surname. A dot ('.') will be appended to the initials automatically, if required. Use the --force-new-cn option to specify the new CN manually and --reset-cn to reset this change.
Use an empty attribute value to remove the specified attribute.
The username specified on the command is the sAMAccountName.

listitem.para: New surname
New given name
New initials
Specify a new CN (RDN) instead of using a combination of the given name, initials and surname.
Set the CN to the default combination of given name, initials and surname.
New display name
New email address
New account name (sAMAccountName/logon name)
New user principal name

refsect3.title: user setexpiry username [options]
refsect3.para: Set the expiration of a user account.

refsect3.title: user setpassword username [options]
refsect3.para: Sets or resets the password of a user account.

refsect3.title: user unlock username [options]
refsect3.para: This command unlocks a user account in the Active Directory domain.

refsect3.title: user getpassword username [options]
refsect3.para: Gets the password of a user account.

refsect3.title: user get-kerberos-ticket username [options]
refsect3.para: Gets a Kerberos Ticket Granting Ticket as the account.

refsect3.title: user syncpasswords --cache-ldb-initialize [options]
refsect3.para: Syncs the passwords of all user accounts, using an optional script.
Note that this command should run on a single domain controller only (typically the PDC-emulator).

refsect3.title: user auth policy assign username [options]
refsect3.para: Set assigned authentication policy for user.

listitem.para: Name of authentication policy to assign or leave empty to remove.

refsect3.title: user auth policy remove username
refsect3.para: Remove assigned authentication policy from user.

refsect3.title: user auth policy view username
refsect3.para: View the assigned authentication policy for user.

refsect3.title: user auth silo assign username [options]
refsect3.para: Set assigned authentication silo for user.

listitem.para: Name of authentication silo to assign or leave empty to remove.

refsect3.title: user auth silo remove username
refsect3.para: Remove assigned authentication silo from user.

refsect3.title: user auth silo view username
refsect3.para: View the assigned authentication silo for user.

refsect2.title: vampire [options] domain
refsect2.para: Join and synchronise a remote AD domain to the local server. Please note that samba-tool vampire is deprecated, please use samba-tool domain join instead.

refsect2.title: visualize [options] subcommand
refsect2.para: Produce graphical representations of Samba network state. To work out what is happening in a replication graph, it is sometimes helpful to use visualisations.
There are two subcommands, two graphical modes, and (roughly) two modes of operation with respect to the location of authority.

listitem.para: Looks at NTDS connections.
Looks at repsTo and repsFrom objects.
Looks at replication lag as shown by the uptodateness vectors.
Distances between DCs are shown in a matrix in the terminal.

Generate Graphviz dot output (for ntdsconn and reps modes). When viewed using dot or xdot, this shows the network as a graph with DCs as vertices and connections edges. Certain types of degenerate edges are shown in different colours or line-styles.
Generate Graphviz dot output as with --dot and attempt to view it immediately using /usr/bin/xdot.

Normally, samba-tool talks to one database; with the -r option attempts are made to contact all the DCs known to the first database. This is necessary for samba-tool visualize uptodateness and for samba-tool visualize reps because the repsFrom/To objects are not replicated, and it can reveal replication issues in other modes.

refsect1.title: VERSION
refsect1.para: This man page is complete for version &doc.version; of the Samba suite.

refsect1.title: AUTHOR
refsect1.para: The original Samba software and related utilities were created by Andrew Tridgell. Samba is now developed by the Samba Team as an Open Source project similar to the way the Linux kernel is developed.
